courses.name: Introduction to Computer Science
courses.description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of computer science and programming, including algorithms, data structures, and programming languages.

courses.name: English Composition
courses.description: This course teaches students the principles of effective writing, including grammar, syntax, and style.

courses.name: College Algebra
courses.description: This course covers the basics of algebra, including linear and quadratic equations, inequalities, and functions.

courses.name: General Physics
courses.description: This course covers the principles of mechanics, including motion, forces, and energy.

courses.name: Introduction to Biology
courses.description: This course provides an overview of the principles of biology, including genetics, ecology, and evolution.

courses.name: World History
courses.description: This course covers the major historical events and trends of world history from ancient times to the present.

courses.name: Introduction to Art
courses.description: This course introduces students to the principles of art and design, including color theory, composition, and art history.

courses.name: Introduction to Economics
courses.description: This course covers the principles of economics, including supply and demand, market structures, and macroeconomic policy.

courses.name: Introduction to Psychology
courses.description: This course covers the fundamentals of psychology, including cognition, perception, learning, and social psychology.

courses.name: Introduction to Sociology
courses.description: This course introduces students to the principles of sociology, including social structures, institutions, and inequality.

courses.name: Introduction to Philosophy
courses.description: This course covers the major philosophical traditions and concepts, including metaphysics, epistemology, and ethics.

courses.name: General Chemistry
courses.description: This course provides an introduction to the principles of chemistry, including atomic and molecular structure, chemical bonding, and chemical reactions.

courses.name: Introduction to Geography
courses.description: This course covers the principles of geography, including physical geography, human geography, and spatial analysis.

courses.name: Introduction to Communication
courses.description: This course covers the fundamentals of communication, including verbal and nonverbal communication, interpersonal communication, and public speaking.

courses.name: Introduction to Music
courses.description: This course introduces students to the principles of music, including music theory, history, and appreciation.

courses.name: Introduction to Anthropology
courses.description: This course covers the principles of anthropology, including cultural anthropology, physical anthropology, and archaeology.
